law.catch_line: Degree of relationship that will bar marriage.

text.section: No marriage shall be contracted between persons who are nearer of kin to each other by consanguinity, whether of the whole or half-blood, than second cousins.
Marriages prohibited by subsection (1) of this section are incestuous and void.

law.history: Amended 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 124, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2096.
